questions.question: What is the main purpose of an IoT dashboard in remote monitoring?

answers.a: To display real-time data from IoT devices

explanations.a: Correct. An IoT dashboard visually represents real-time data from IoT devices for monitoring and analysis.
explanations.b: Incorrect. While dashboards can allow control, their main purpose is monitoring.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Hardware design is done separately.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Dashboards use cloud storage but do not replace it.

questions.question: Which component is commonly used to send sensor data to the IoT dashboard?

explanations.a: Correct. Microcontrollers like Arduino or ESP8266 send sensor data to cloud platforms.
explanations.b: Incorrect. LED displays only show local output.
explanations.c: Incorrect. A power bank only provides power.
explanations.d: Incorrect. A keyboard is not used for IoT data transmission.

questions.question: Which platform can be used to store and visualize IoT sensor data?

explanations.a: Correct. ThingSpeak is a cloud platform that can store and visualize IoT data.
explanations.b: Incorrect. MS Word is for document editing.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Notepad is for plain text editing.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Photoshop is for image editing.

questions.question: Why is cloud connectivity important in an IoT dashboard system?

answers.a: It enables remote access to device data from anywhere
answers.b: It makes the system faster than local storage
answers.c: It removes the need for sensors

explanations.a: Correct. Cloud connectivity allows the dashboard to be accessed from anywhere with internet.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Speed is not the main reason for cloud use.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Sensors are still needed to collect data.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Cloud systems require internet, not offline mode.
